metadata.title: CVE-2016-1241 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Tryton 3.x before 3.2.17, 3.4.x before 3.4.14, 3.6.x before 3.6.12, 3.8.xbefore 3.8.8, and 4.x before 4.0.4 allow remote authenticated users todiscover user password hashes via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1241` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tryton-server - 4.0.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tryton-server package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.4-1').
